member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether automatic authentication for the application trying to access the secrets storage is enabled. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When automatic authentication is enabled, authentication will proceed with the following steps: - Try to use the to retrieve the access token for the application from the Azure Service using the required authority, resource, and scope. - If that fails, it will resort to "normal authentication". When automatic authentication is disabled (thus normal authentication is to be used), authentication will proceed with the following steps: - The application credentials (client id and client secret) set in these options will be used. - If the credentials are available, they will be used to retrieve the access token using the AD authentication context. - If the credentials are not available, an error will be raised.
